result.execSummary:
The defendant Asa Gerald Grimm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Asa Gerald Grimm is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Asa Gerald Grimm was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Counts 2 & 3 dismissed.
Defendant to sign up for probation by 10:30 am on August 5, 2014.

miscConds.notes:
Judge Edward F. Vlack approved Restitution Worksheet October 13, 2014.

To be submitted within 30 days.
Court costs and surcharge paid in full. Bond applied.

- AODA within 45 days;
- Psychological/Psychiatric evaluation within 30 days;
- Any evaluation and or assessment as directed by agent; 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol. 
- Not to possess a firearm.
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
- No abusive contact with D Blanco.
- Apology letter to the victim within 30 days.
- Participate in Restorative Justice if victim requests.
- Maintain employment.
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
- Follow all rules and regulations of DOC/Agent.
- Pay supervision fees.
- DNA and pay surcharge.

 Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for Amended Count one, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def Guilty of Amended count 1. Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed.

CO: Vlack, DAR, Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Micheal Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Joseph R Caton   DF:  Asa Gerald Grimm appeared from jail. Case called at 3:38 pm. Preliminary Waiver is presented to the court. Court questions Defendant. Recess. Recalled at 3:44 pm. Court finds waiver is done freely and voluntarily. Court finds probable cause and binds Def over for trial. ADA Niekes present information to the court. Court informs Defendant of charges possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. NG on all counts. Atty Caton asserts right to Speedy trial. Bond continues. km  Status conference scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 10:15 am.
Appointing Atty Caton. km
Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Daniel B.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
